text: The 1964–65 WHL season was the thirteenth season of the Western Hockey League. The Portland Buckaroos were the President's Cup champions as they beat the Victoria Maple Leafs in five games in the final series. == Final Standings == {| class="wikitable sortable" |+Coast Division Standings1964-65 Western Hockey League Standings ! scope="col" style="width:3em" | ! scope="col" style="width:12em" | Team ! scope="col" style="width:3em" class="unsortable" | ! scope="col" style="width:3em"| ! scope="col" style="width:3em" | ! scope="col" style="width:3em" | ! scope="col" style="width:4em" | ! scope="col" style="width:4em" | ! scope="col" style="width:4em"| |- style="text-align:center;font-weight:bold;" | 1 || style="text-align:left;" | Portland Buckaroos || 70 || 42 || 23 || 5 || 267 || 216 || 89 |- style="text- align:center;font-weight:bold;" | 2 || style="text-align:left;" | Seattle Totems || 70 || 36 || 30 || 4 || 204 || 198 || 76 |- style="text- align:center;font-weight:bold;" | 3 || style="text-align:left;" | Vancouver Canucks || 70 || 32 || 32 || 6 || 263 || 244 || 70 |- style="text- align:center;font-weight:bold;" | 4 || style="text-align:left;" | Victoria Maple Leafs || 70 || 32 || 36 || 2 || 246 || 242 || 66 |- style="text- align:center;" | 5 || style="text-align:left;" | San Francisco Seals || 70 || 31 || 37 || 2 || 255 || 283 || 64 |- style="text-align:center;" | 6 || style="text-align:left;" | Los Angeles Blades || 70 || 26 || 41 || 3 || 217 || 269 || 55 |} bold - qualified for playoffs == Playoffs == The Portland Buckaroos win the President's Cup 4 games to 1.WHL Playoff Results == References == Category:Western Hockey League (1952–1974) seasons Category:1964–65 in American ice hockey by league Category:1964–65 in Canadian ice hockey by league
